title: 5 Location Lighting Accessories to Make Your Life Easier
summary: Professional photographer Lindsay Adler shares five essential lighting accessories that simplify on-location photography. She covers tools for stabilization, mounting, and light modification that improve portability, speed up workflow, and solve common logistical problems like travel weight and shooting without permits.

steps.action: Use self-collapsing light stands to move quickly between locations without bumping into obstacles.
Utilize a handheld light pole (boom) instead of a stand to avoid permit issues in cities and allow assistants to follow moving subjects easily.
Replace heavy sandbags with water weight bags that can be filled on-site for stability without the travel bulk.
steps.tool: Westcott HurleyPro H2Pro Water Weight Bag

steps.action: Use an ergonomic cold shoe adapter to quickly mount and adjust the angle of speedlights without fiddling with small knobs.
Switch to pop-up or collapsible modifiers to eliminate the time-consuming process of assembling softbox rods.
steps.tool: Profoto Clic Softboxes / Westcott Rapid Box

key_takeaways: Choose gear that collapses automatically or pops up quickly to save time and reduce stress on location.
Use water-based weights for travel to avoid carrying heavy sandbags.
Handheld light poles offer greater mobility for moving subjects and can bypass restrictions on placing stands on the ground in public spaces.
Ergonomic mounting tools significantly speed up adjustments when using speedlights.
